dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, uh, Host_B, can we just talk about Tesla for a sec? Like, the stock just went absolutely wild after their latest earnings report.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, uh, Host B, can we just talk about Tesla for a sec? Like, the stock just went absolutely wild after their latest earnings report.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The shares spiked following the results announcement, rising 11% to $644.99 in after-hours Nasdaq trading.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh my gosh, yeah! Shares were up, what, like 11%? It’s been an incredible run since October, honestly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh my gosh, yeah! Shares were up, what, like eleven percent? It's been an incredible run since October, honestly.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The shares spiked following the results announcement, rising 11% to $644.99 in after-hours Nasdaq trading. Theyve has more than doubled since a surprise third-quarter profit announcement on Oct. 23.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. And they actually *beat* expectations, right? Net income of $550 million for the quarter, on revenue of almost $7.4 billion.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. And they actually beat expectations, right? Net income of five hundred fifty million dollars for the quarter, on revenue of almost seven point four billion dollars.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Silicon Valley-based carmaker reported net income for the quarter of $105 million on revenue of $7.38 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, which, you know, topped what analysts were expecting. And a big part of that, again, was the zero-emission credit sales. Like, $133 million in free money.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, which, you know, topped what analysts were expecting. And a big part of that, again, was the zero-emission credit sales. Like, one hundred thirty three million dollars in free money.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: That topped expectations of $1.72 a share and revenue of $7.02 billion, according to a Reuters survey of equity analysts. Tesla once again got a boost from sales of zero-emission and other regulatory credits to other automakers in the quarter, booking $133 million of the free money.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right, it's like, a consistent boost for them. And Elon Musk even called last year a "turning point" in his letter to investors, talking about Model 3 demand and, um, GAAP profitability.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, it's like, a consistent boost for them. And Elon Musk even called last year a turning point in his letter to investors, talking about Model three demand and, um, G A A P profitability.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Last year was a turning point for Tesla, Musk said in a letter to investors. We demonstrated strong organic demand for Model 3, returned to GAAP profitability in 2H19 and generated $1.1B of free cash flow for the year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! They’re really trying to push this new narrative, like, Tesla isn't just about promises anymore. It's a profitable, cash-generative tech company.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! They're really trying to push this new narrative, like, Tesla isn't just about promises anymore. It's a profitable, cash-generative tech company.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This quarter may be seen as the moment a new genre of tech investors were waiting to perceive Tesla through a new narrative: as a profitable and cash generative tech company with a reasonably-sized market cap in the same discussion as the mega-tech platform names, Morgan Stanley equity analyst Adam Jonas said in a research note.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Which is a huge shift, you know? After all those years of, like, wobbly finances and... well, everything.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is a huge shift, you know? After all those years of, like, wobbly finances and... well, everything.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: After years of wobbly finances, wild stock price swings, unfulfilled promises and Musks self-inflicted wounds from fights with securities regulators and critics, the company may be showing signs of more stable operations.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. And they’re not slowing down on production either. Model Y production started early, which is pretty big news.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. And they're not slowing down on production either. Model Y production started early, which is pretty big news.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In a surprise announcement, it said production of Model Y crossovers started this month at the Fremont, California, plant, earlier than initially scheduled.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, at Fremont! And the Shanghai plant is, like, running as expected. But then, the Berlin plant, there are those, uh, environmental concerns.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, at Fremont! And the Shanghai plant is, like, running as expected. But then, the Berlin plant, there are those, uh, environmental concerns.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Meanwhile, Teslas Shanghai plant that opened in record time in January is running as expected. Preparations for its third vehicle assembly plant, to be built near Berlin, are moving ahead... That remains to be seen, owing to local German opposition to Teslas plans to cut down a portion of existing forest and concerns about how much water the plant will use.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, definitely. Cutting down the forest, the water usage… that's still a big hurdle for them.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, definitely. Cutting down the forest, the water usage... that's still a big hurdle for them.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: That remains to be seen, owing to local German opposition to Teslas plans to cut down a portion of existing forest and concerns about how much water the plant will use.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It is. But you gotta admit, the Model Y, it could really hit a sweet spot in the EV crossover market. That's what some analysts are saying.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It is. But you gotta admit, the Model Y, it could really hit a sweet spot in the E V crossover market. That's what some analysts are saying.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tesla got a bit lucky in that the market evolved around them: unplanned, the Model Y might slide right in the sweet spot for the EV crossover market, said Jessica Caldwell, executive director of industry insights at Edmunds.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. But even with all this good news, we can't forget, um, they still posted a full-year loss of $862 million. They’ve actually never had an annual profit.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. But even with all this good news, we can't forget, um, they still posted a full-year loss of eight hundred sixty two million dollars. They've actually never had an annual profit.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Teslas full-year loss was $862 million on record revenue of $26 billion. A decade after its initial public offering its never posted an annual profit.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: That's the kicker, right? Garrett Nelson, an analyst with a "Sell" rating, is still flagging risks—like the China factory ramp-up and rising EV competition.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's the kicker, right? Garrett Nelson, an analyst with a Sell rating, is still flagging risks-like the China factory ramp-up and rising E V competition.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Amid the rosy numbers, CFRA equity analyst Garrett Nelson, who has a Sell rating on Tesla, thinks there are still reasons for caution. We continue to see significant risks related to the China factory ramp-up, as well as rising EV competition from automakers still eligible for the full federal tax credit in the U.S., Nelson said in a research note.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and the loss of the full federal tax credit in the U.S. for their vehicles is a factor for future sales, too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and the loss of the full federal tax credit in the U.S. for their vehicles is a factor for future sales, too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We continue to see significant risks related to the China factory ramp-up, as well as rising EV competition from automakers still eligible for the full federal tax credit in the U.S., Nelson said in a research note.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, a phenomenal quarter, no doubt, but still, like, some really big questions about the long game.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, a phenomenal quarter, no doubt, but still, like, some really big questions about the long game.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much sums it up for Tesla, doesn't it? Wild ride.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much sums it up for Tesla, doesn't it? Wild ride.
